meanings.definition: To soar higher or more impressively than something else.
meanings.sent1: The eagle was outsoaring the other birds in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The hot air balloon was outsoaring the clouds.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape billowed behind him as he outsoared the villain.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were outsoaring the limitations of reality.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outsoared all expectations and reached the stars.

meanings.definition: To surpass in flying or rising above.
meanings.sent1: The kite outsoared the other kites at the park.
meanings.sent2: The helicopter was outsoaring the treetops.
meanings.sent3: The paper airplane unexpectedly outsoared the model airplane.
meanings.sent4: His determination outsoared his fear of failure.
meanings.sent5: The eagle outsoared its previous altitude record.

meanings.definition: To exceed in height or altitude.
meanings.sent1: The skyscraper outsoared all the other buildings in the city.
meanings.sent2: The mountain peak was outsoaring the surrounding landscape.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe outsoared the other animals at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits outsoared the challenges she faced.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outsoared the clouds and disappeared into space.
